oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - American Ace - 1947-12-06 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 1 of excerpts from an American Ace sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment (7:30-8:00 pm) from December 6, 1947. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), and performers Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys, the Tennessee Belles, Tommy Jackson, Uncle Dave Macon, Pap's Jug Band, Sonny Day, and Bashful Brother Oswald. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Roy Acuff; Smoky Mountain Boys; Tennessee Belles; Tommy Jackson
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Opening theme -- Opening statement (Grant Turner) -- Jealous Heart (Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys) -- Roy Acuff introduces the Tennessee Belles -- My Love Turned Me Down In The Hills (Tennessee Belles) -- American Ace Coffee commercial (Grant Turner) -- Roy Acuff introduces Tommy Jackson -- Soldier's Joy (Tommy Jackson fiddle) -- Roy Acuff talks -- Heart That Was Broken For Me (Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); Grand ole opry (Radio program); Acuff, Roy; Smoky Mountain Boys; Tennessee Belles; Wilson, Lonnie; Pap's Jug Band; Jackson, Tommy; Macon, Uncle Dave, 1870-1952; Day, Sonny (Accordionist); Bashful Brother Oswald; Turner, Grant;
